item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, January 31, 2025 at 6:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Apple files emergency motion to become defendant in US vs. Google [pdf] (157 points | 105 comments)
2. Show HN: Uscope, a New Linux Debugger Written from Scratch (56 points | 10 comments)
3. Zusie – My Relay Computer (38 points | 5 comments)

6. Shell-ish scripting in Go with ease (16 points | 1 comment)

8. Images reveal exocomets around nearby stars (49 points | 2 comments)
9. Distro (YC S24) Is Hiring a Chief of Staff in Palo Alto ( | hide)
10. MillenniumDB: Property graph and RDF engine, still in development (38 points | 7 comments)
11. Real-time, river sections downstream of sewage discharges from storm overflows (15 points | discuss)
12. Taking a $15 Casio F91W 5km underwater (255 points | 66 comments)
13. Show HN: voidDB – A transactional key-value DB written in Go for 64-bit Linux (28 points | 7 comments)
14. Hydro: Distributed Programming Framework for Rust (200 points | 35 comments)
15. How to Train an AI Image Model on Yourself (53 points | 10 comments)

17. Developers should embrace creative coding again (56 points | 60 comments)
18. Hacker News for Gamedev (370 points | 170 comments)

20. Building a Mesh Using Spherical Embedding (32 points | 4 comments)
21. Rubywm: An X11 window manager in pure Ruby (130 points | 25 comments)
22. Quantel Paintbox History (22 points | 12 comments)
23. Ozempic is causing trouble on Savile Row (33 points | 43 comments)
24. A better build system for OCaml (324 points | 177 comments)
25. Ear muscle we thought humans didn't use activates when people listen hard (163 points | 134 comments)
26. Stats – macOS system monitor in your menu bar (401 points | 154 comments)
27. Xerox Alto Source Code (2014) (100 points | 21 comments)
28. NSF starts vetting all grants to comply with executive orders (170 points | 314 comments)
29. My Cat Mii (260 points | 55 comments)
30. The story of my home made pipe organ (2000) (269 points | 50 comments)
